body.p: Editors may review and correct database objects owned by other users even if no specific rights for the database object were granted to them, allowing them to review and edit the data.

ul.li: Can edit all items in a database, i.e. a corpus, a lemma list, or the thesaurus database, where they have been assigned editor rights.
Can add or remove database objects within a corpus.
Can assign the Updater or Reader status to other users, but only for individual database objects.

Can technically change their own status as a Reader or an Updater. This is irrelevant however, because the user role "Editor" takes precedence (as in the case of the Admin).
NOTE: These rights apply only for database objects with visibility "project", "public", or "all authenticated". In all other instances, the editor has only access to the database objects if they have been assigned the Updater or Reader status.

In cases where the corpus was created by someone else, editors can modify individual database objects, but are attributed a guest role for the corpus itself (i.e. they cannot edit the corpus passport data, or assign Updaters/Readers for an entire corpus).
The editor cannot create new corpora within a project.
